caption: We first ordered takeout from this restaurant and were so impressed that we had to try it in person! The ajumma who took our order was very warm and gave us suggestions - we know our favorites in Korean food, but she gave us new dishes to try from their large menu. As a vegetarian, I really liked the japchae and soondubu jigae (perfectly spicy), and others ordered the spicy pork ssam and fried chicken, which earned raves. The hotteok for dessert, with warm sake, was a treat - I haven't often seen it on the menu in the metro area. Will definitely go back.

The food is sooo good and fresh! All the ingredients were fresh and cooked when ordered. Very good flavours and cooked with a lot of care. The staff is incredibly friendly, and the owner came by to talk with us and offer us kimchi her mom made. Was an amazing experience. The interior is very clean and great ambience for family nights, time with friends, or for a date!

This restaurant is my favorite. I go to many restaurants but to this place I  constantly return again and again. The team is very amicable and the cuisine they place on your table is so yummy. I never decline to have a good meal here. I recommend this place with pleasure.

Amazing food and great service! We came here on vacation and we’re not disappointed by the quality and quantity of food. They implemented great social distancing measures too. Would definitely come here again.
The best Korean food in DC!  Great atmosphere, the staff were super hospitable, and was made to feel like family almost immediately. <3
Love this place. Will be eating here every time I'm in AM

Amazing food! The Korean Fried Chicken was incredible, I was interested in trying it without sauce and I was blown away. It was so crispy and the chicken was cooked perfectly. We also had the kimchi soup with tofu, it comes with a side of rice, this was also incredibly delicious! The last dish we tried was a noodle dish called japchae (I'm not sure how it's spelled) and again, it was so delicious. I've never heard of this dish but I'm so glad we tried it! Our server was perfect, he was very helpful and I felt very COVID safe. We sat on the patio on a beautiful day and it was just so nice to not have to eat at home!

My friends and I have visited BUL a lot in the past couple months, while we had an extended stay in DC and it quickly became one of our favorite restaurants. The food is good, and the staff is great! After our first visit, the waiter who served us remembered our drink and food orders which we did not expect. Over time he remembered our friend group and would ask about those who didn't come by during each visit. We all greatly appreciated the thoughtfulness of remembering those details, my friends and I have many fond memories of this restaurant and look forward to visiting if we return to the area!

I'm so glad this place was open! They had options for indoor and outdoor seating (with good spacing). My friend and I chose to stay inside for a little warmth by right by the door to feel safer. Our server was super kind and attentive (thank you!).  As a vegetarian, I felt like I had a lot of options because any meat was added as extra. I went with my favorite Tofu Dolsot and it was very delicious, though I feel like there could have been a better veggie to rice balance. My friend got the Soondubu with meat and as someone who is super sensitive to spiciness levels, he was able to handle it and thought it was delicious!  Overall a great experience! The food really warmed me up on a cold day and I would definitely come back for some more Korean comfort food.
Love this place and the seafood omelet!
I like this restaurant very much. theres a very nice spirit. The cuisine is great. the service is efficient and the crew is trained. The cost is satisfactory. extremely recommend.

LOVE LOVE LOVE!!! After moving from DC a few months ago, I recently took a trip back and BUL was literally the only place I HAD to eat. Phenomenal as usual. The sweet and spicy fried chicken and takoyako are must haves. Cannot wait to go back.
Great experience. Good food. Kind staff.

I often take my friends to this restaurant with my highest recommendations. I visit this place often. I get very good feedback from my friends. The the food there is delicious and the team is efficient and cooperative. always when we go to this place we pass a splendid time.  highly recommended.
I ordered for delivery  and it didn't arrive- called the restaurant and they said it was the delivery service's fault not theirs. Not helpful at all. Do not recommend them.

I used to love this restaurant but the quality has gone down significantly. I recently ordered the spicy pork ssam and kimchi pancake and was highly disappointed. The spicy pork is not spicy at all it actually is as sweet as bulgogi. It also did not come with lettuce which was the entire point of ordering the ssam meal. And the kimchi pancake had no kimchi in it (I thoroughly checked to see if small bits were in there) and was flavorless. It was legit like a regular pancake with red dye and green onions. As someone who has lived in Korea for 3 years I can say that this place is a joke, please go to a more authentic place or a place that doesn’t tone down flavor and cut corners.
Great bulgogi!
Bomb food
My go-to Korean barstaurant in the admo area. I always order budaejjigae and pork belly ssam. Their food became even more delicious recently😁
Food is ok, but slightly off, but it's one of a few Korean restaurants in DC.

(Translated by Google) I visited in the US because I wanted to eat Korean food, but the staff were very unfriendly. Even though I'm the same Korean, maybe I'd like to treat Daewoo like that ... I almost spilled it on me when I was too hot. . I eat at the restaurant and give plenty of tips. It was nice to have Korean food at the place, so I will give you two points.  (Original) 미국에서 한식이 먹고싶어서 방문했는데 직원들이 너무 불친절했습니다. 같은 한국인인데도 불구하고 어쩌면 대우를 저렇게 하나싶을정도로요... 뜨거운 음식도 자칫하면 저한테 쏟을뻔했는데 죄송하다는 말 한마디도 없었고 물도 옆테이블 현지인들에게는 줘놓고 우리한테는 주지도 않고 계속 불렀더니 그제서야 오더군요. 식당에서 밥먹고 팁은 넉넉하게 주는편인데 서비스가 너무 엉망이라 팁도 안주고 그냥 나왔습니다. 낮선곳에서 한식이 반가웠기에 그나마 2점이라도 드립니다.
Excellent Korean comfort food and super delicious Korean Fried Chicken
Tasty. Better to visit out of rush hour. Food might not be legit spicy.
Amazing food, great service, delicious food, will definitely be back
Absolutely a spot worth trying, the food is great and well prepared, the prices are convenient and it is constantly well organized here. Fantastic work.
I came here for lunch, and we were seated right away. The dukbokki was very mushy, but I enjoyed the jigae and the bibimbap. Service was fast and great.
yummy, kinda loud but was a good meal
Super delicious Korean Fried Chicken, truly finger licking good
Best Korean-ish dishes in DC.
Decent Korean fried chicken
Prompt service. Delicious food.

Rare find in Washington DC for decent Korean food. I'd recommend the bulgogi dolsot over the tofu kimchi stew because the latter tends to come with minced beef / small portions of seafood. Good place for a weekday night out - can get noisy at times. Service level is good but could take time to get seated / place orders.

visited my friend in DC, and we saw this place nearby and it looked delicious so we decided to try it, and we were not disappointed! -budae jjigae had so many ingredients in it, like ramen and spam, and it was not too spicy or salty! it tasted really good with the rice and as something to even out the other dishes -the spicy seafood udon was delicious. It was a mixture of udon with seafood in a spicy sauce, and i was scared of the seafood being too little, but the dish came with so much seafood! the octopus was plump and thick, and it complemented the noodles well. -the pork belly, my FAVORITE! yes some pieces of the pork belly were tough, but still did not take away from how delicious it was. It came with garlic and kimchi on the side, and the pork belly was seasoned just right so it wasn't bland at all! highly recommend, and it's good to share! -the  korean fries were a really good dish to eat on the side because we ordered a peach soju also. There was kimchi, and i thought the sauce would be overwhelming, but it didn't make the fries soggy or anything. the creamy sauce went well with the spicy kimchi, and the fries were crispy if you are looking for a place to eat delicious korean food with good vibes and maybe drink a bit with friends, this is the place!!

Nice place to come and drink, but I think the atmosphere and decor masks the taste of the food. Have tried many things on the menu and the only decent item is the Korean Fried Chicken. The kim chi jjigae is really bland and just tastes like water with gochujang. If you are going here to drink and have anju (bar food), that is fine, but if you are coming strictly to eat, I would find an alternative.

Just go.  The only place better is Sakuramen which is on the same street and has the same owner.  Bul is open later, serves 21+ drinks and has a different ambience (better suited for groups than Saku).  I could be specific but JUST GO!
Spicy pork ssam is so tasty reminds me of being back in korea with jae yook dubap.

I made a reservation for 6:00 PM early in the morning by email per the BUL's website instructions.   When I called back at 4:00 PM to confirm my reservation, I was told the restaurant wasn't taking any more reservations, but I could walk-in.  I responded I had made the reservation by email early (around 8:00 AM).  All the restaurant could say was they hadn't bothered to check the emails.  So, I give them one star for poor management response to the instructions on their own website.  I made the reservation early in the morning.  They could have figured out a way to accommodate me.  Maybe the food's really good, but the response to my reservation left a bad taste in my mouth.  That said, we went at 6:00 to find many empty tables.  We waited about 5 minutes and were seated.  Things turned positive after that.  Service was quick and very professional.  Food was delicious.  We had short ribs, KFC chicken, and Sea snails with Noodles.  All three dishes were well portioned and excellently prepared.  I'll raise my rating to 4 stars based on the actual in-restaurant experience.  Recommendation: Call if you want a reservation.  The staff's multitasking and reading chats/emails might not be a priority.  Be ready to wait if you arrive much later than 7:00.  By the time we left at 7:30 the restaurant was packed and the wait line stretched onto the street.
decent food, very spicy and a bit too much sauce. great service
Good food and a cozy environment. Love the kimchi fried and Korean fried chicken. Bulgogi tacos are great. I recommend the Honey Yuzu tea for a hot drink

We love eating here. We were seated quickly and they were so accommodating to us when our daughter was sleeping on my lap even though they didn’t need to. As a parents, you know that’s great service. Food was great and was a great value! We got the korean fried chicken ( a must here!), the kimchi fries with bulgogi and the cucumber salad.
Just awesome korean street food. Wish they had a liquor license though but the korean alcohol they serve is legit. Would recommend getting drunk with friends here.

Great food, especially enjoyed the kimchi fried rice and the Korean fries. I do wish the Korean fries were a bit crispier though, but they were still great. My wife also appreciated that there was Korean fried chicken that was not all glazed for once. I would recommend this place to anyone I know.

great atmosphere, great food, and great prices what more could you possible ask for? staff are chill and friendly and will help you promptly and the food was very good.  jjamppong is nice and spicy (but not over done) and the portions sizes are great for the price (they give you a TON of rice) and free water  atmosphere is nice as well  would recommend 12/10
First time eating Korean food...sold me!!
The food was okay...i don't have to go back.
Did someone say Korean tapas!probably not but I did and this is one of those hole in the wall good stuff in DC
The food and wine was delicious. I definitely plan on coming back my next DC trip.
BUL KFC, so spicy but absolutely amazing.  One of the best meals I've had in DC and very reasonable.
Delicious!
Very tasty dishes. We are from out of town and found it by accident but glad we did. Seems to be very popular place to eat.
KFC and soju. Can't go wrong, baby.
Neat spot with interesting seasonal drinks. Check out their Soju infused watermelon drinks; it's great for a group!
Delicious, and good service

HORRIBLE and extremely unprofessionally  service. We wanted to sit outside. The host  promised a ten minutes wait. We ended up waiting for ONE HOUR. He refused to add one chair to an available table to accommodate us instead of waiting and gave the table to other walk-in clients. He also didn’t suggest to sit inside and gave tables to other walk-in clients. When I went to ask for a table inside he kept me waiting for ten minutes before he even spoke with me. He never apologized.
Not the best Korean food, but definitely pretty good for the price. Quick service. Nice ambiance.
Food was bland. Service was blandER.
Delicious food. Great service. Reasonable prices. A must-go spot to eat!
Awesome spot tucked away in admo. The atmosphere here was cozy, but very trendy. Wait staff was friendly, explaining the menu. And the FOOD was life! Try the KFC wings m, they did not disappoint!
Good service. Okay food.
Fantastic food at great prices, attentive and kind waitstaff, and a wonderful atmosphere. I'm in DC for a conference and I'm glad I got the chance to eat here!
Amazing place!
Pretty good selection of Korean street food!
Our waitress was great and patient with being clear on what we wanted. We had several of the small plate items that was delicious!
Good food, very loud.
Great Korean fare. Very flavorful and spicy! Great service. Good vegetarian options. Nice bar.
Their soju is reasonably priced. My go tos are the KFC (of course), seafood pancake, and kimchi stew.

We went to Bul with a group and while the starters were okay the main dishes left us underwhelmed. The noodle sea food dish had more pasta than anything else and tasted like stock tomato sauce. The hot plate had the rice burned. Maybe it is that we worked and lived throughout Asia for 5 years that has left us spoiled, but this was rather underwhelming.
Great food. Recommend going with a group and spitting a bunch of stuff.

One of my three favorite places to eat in Washington, D.C.  It's easy to get a table, their service is amazing, and the food is so so so good.  Make sure to get a corn cheese or five when you go and bless yourself with its gooey, sweet deliciousness, and follow it up with an extra spicy whole "K.F.C." for your crew.
Ok food with alright service....
Best Korean restaurant

Pricy....but it is delicious. If it was cheaper, I would go more often. You can get food to go, they have SOJU, they have Rice Wine, they do not have Korean BBQ. Kimichi Soup was a little sweet than what I have had in Korea.  Instagram: @happyhour_dc
Food was amazing. And the wait time was great.

Waited when there were visibly open tables, specifically 2 of us waiting when there were multiple 4 person tables which I could have understood if it weren't for the fact that after we were seated, they had seated other 2 person parties at those tables. Service was a bit slow even though it wasn't super busy, and the jjambbong was definitely over priced, however it and the BUL KFC tasted very good.
decent Korean bar food.
Food is good and spicy. Plentiful portions. Space is limited and a little tight.

We tried the BUL Korean fried chicken. Never tasted anything so spicy. The waitress was kind enough to warn us about it and gave us the sauce on the side. We also tried the fried wontons which were good. It's a good restaurant but definitely beware of the spice levels as spicy here means some serious amount of chillies!
The food was outstanding!the staff was very friendly and the atmosphere was onpoint.

I saw BUL on PBS DC eats. I finally got a chance to try it out this weekend. Good flavors for a nice break if your stuck in the same old routine (French, Italian, "American"). I tried the Makgeolli. Pretty good if you like a slightly caramel/sweet/milky rice wine. At 6%, it's easy to drink. I liked it. Also the special cup was a nice touch. My wife tried the Jinro 24, which means 24% alcohol which might be a bit much for some. 1 little bottle would be like a full bottle of wine. The food was good. Surprisingly even though we ordered some spicy dishes (Dukbokki), they did not have much heat to them. I guess I was under the impression that Korean food was spicier. Overall, it was a good experience with tubular rice cakes, tasty seafood pancakes (with a binder that I couldn't out my finger on) and traditional Bulgogi. Finally, BUL is in the heart of Adams Morgan so it's easy to continue the evening after dinner.
The food is ok

TL; DR if you are 21+ the Watermelon SOJU is amazing, bulgogi fries are a must try, Budae Jjigae is worth a try!  I was just chilling at my cousins' house one afternoon and then nonchalantly one of them said that he'd been craving for budae jjigae (Korean army base stew).  The next thing I knew, we were in the car headed to Adam's Morgan!  We ordered watermelon soju, calamari, bulgogi with rice, bulgogi fries, corn cheese, wings and the budae jjigae.  I usually don't like alcohol but flavored soju is AMAZING... the watermelon masks the taste of alcohol so well, it ended up just tasting like watermelon juice.  The calamari came out super crunchy, the bulgogi with rice was for my adorable 6 month old niece to eat, and the wings were really crunchy and had the perfect amount of sauce covering it!   The bulgogi fries were out of this world, potatoes just seem to make something already good, great!  The fries were the perfect vehicle for the bulgogi, while the cheese held all the pieces of crispy bulgogi and other toppings together!  My cousins' have never heard of corn cheese before so of course I had to order it!  The corn cheese went really well with the korean fried chicken and the budae jjigae.  The budae jjigae really hit the spot, it had everything from spam to beans, It was really good!  The service was super friendly and all our food came out in a timely manner!  I can't wait to come back to see what else they have to offer!
The fried chicken is really tasty!!!
Good food. It's a bit pricey for those on a budget.

Service totally blows. Came hear as a party of 2. There were 3 empty tables but they wouldn't seat us because the tables were only for parties of 4. When we pointed that out they didn't care and told us to wait at the bar for one of the tables for 2 to open up. When we walked out they didn't even care.
Pretty good - enjoyed some menu items, others were a bit on the bland side for us. But everything felt fresh and well-made. The service is polite and efficient.
food was good but not special. Don’t expect real Korean food. just fun.
Great service and everything is delicious
Great bar staff, o-dari and small bites, beer sake at good prices. Love the atmosphere!

Atmosphere was nice. Two window tables, about 10-12 other 4 seat tables and a bar. Food was high quality and fresh. Korean Fried Chicken was crispy and moist on inside. Bulgolgi was flavorful and not sweet. The Korean Short Ribs were tender and moist, but my plate was actually majority bones with no meat. That is the only thing that brought eating down from 4 to 3 stars.
So tasty! Extra credit because this kind of food in DC proper is scarce!

This place is a lovely Korean place!  We had fried mandu, pajeon, pork belly ssam and bulgogi dish and they were all delicious. They were the right kind of spicy and my friend Rachel who had never tasted Korean food before enjoyed it very much, including the spicy chilli paste.  Service was great, and the price was average for a city like Washington DC, but it was a little bit of walk from the metro station. The location, however, was perfect on the street with a lot of different other food and bar options.
Food was good but not at great as the options further out of DC
Excellent
Really good food here, you will be paying Adam's Morgan prices.
Excellent food for an overall fair price for the area.
Food tasted bland. Water was warm.  Nobody greeted us at the door. Receipt was in a box. Very disappointed.

Had bibimbop and bulgogi taco here.  Surprisingly good, hidden away in the non-Korean enclave of Admas Morgan!  Saw a group of Korean diplomats eating there the same time.  They have my stamp of approval!
Very attentive staff and excellent food. The kimchee dumplings, beef stew, spring rolls, and bulgogi dishes are very tasty.

Great service and even better food! I've been on vacation with my mother for two weeks now, and out of ALL the places we've been to and eaten at, this place was definitely the best by far!! Definitely recommend!!

Very authentic dokkbuki! Bibimbap is pretty good.  Crab puffs come seebed on a pool of spicy sweet chili dipping sauce and was delish.  They serve a korean  raspberry wine that was like red wine with raspberry flavor
Bad mael

I'm gonna complain about the service of this restaurant!! I never had that bad experience like today before. When we first in this restaurant, the server told us the wait time is 30mins, we can seat in the bar, but after 10 mins, there is 3 table available, the chair in the bar is super uncomfortable, so where to put my foot, so I ask the to change the table, at this time we don't have any food on the table, They just saids No, they can't move us to the table. The other thing make me so mad is we order a soup, but there is a hair in the bowl, when I ask service, they ask me" IS THAT YOUR HAIR？" Excuse me?? I'm not a homeless! I'm a customer. They don't even say sorry or any apology to us. That's so rude. If they don't change their service, I will never go there again and I will tell all my friends don't go there anymore. Ridiculous! Horrible! Restaurant! No respect!
Good service. Not very authentically korean.

We ordered the K.F.C (Korean Fried Chicken) and the bibbimbap and it was pretty delicious! The fried chicken's marinade is not spicy but offers a tangier taste. The bibbimbap had an assortment of the toppings you would expect but there was more rice than toppings in this spot. Service was good as the waiter kept checking up on us. Not a bad spot for a korean style tapas joint.
Great Korean restaurant. Highly recommend seafood pancake, budae jjigae and bibimbap.
Amazing friend chicken, loved the kimchi pork belly fries and the mozzarella corn was fun.
LOVE THEIR ORIGINAL KOREAN FRIED CHICKEN
Great food!

My experience was great! I got the spicy Korean chicken tacos, seasoned fries, and a Kloud beer when I ate gere with a friend. The spicy tacos had just enough flavor and the portion size was just right. My favorite part of my meal was the fries though! The fries were perfectly crispy with the perfect amount of batter. I would definitely come back just for the fries.  If you have never tried Korean beer, the Kloud beer is a good one to try. It is easy to drink and is a freat addition to the meal.  This iw a great place to go to if you are in the Adams Morgan area or are wanting to walk somewhere before going to the zoo.
(Translated by Google) The food was poorly prepared and the soft drinks for diabetic  (Original) La comida estaba mal elaborada y los refrescos para diabetico
Everything I've had from bul is good. If you are truly spicy tolerant go for the hottest but make sure the server knows you can handle it.
I loved their Korean Fried chicken!!!
Pork  was  over cook! Slow  service!
It was good but not great. I’d say more 3 1/2 stars. Mixed drinks a pretty good.
Nothing special there. The dishes served at the most are Korean like, far from being authentic.  The service is great, prompt and friendly. It's good for gathering.
Nice kimchijjigae
Excellent Japanese beer selection that you won't find anywhere else! Orion is still a rather rare sight and they have big bottles at the right price. Food is great as well!
Huge portions of delicious food. Their spicy food is perfectly spiced!
Great happy hour specials, and they know exactly what you're going for when you order Cass and a bottle of Soju.
Great Korean fusion restaurant

(Translated by Google) Highly recommended !! Rabokki is really delicious and the chicken is seasoned rather than soy sauce! Kimchi jjigae has a unique taste but it is delicious. I was a little surprised by the strong tip, but I still recommend it!  (Original) 강추!! 라볶이 진짜 맛있고 치킨은 간장보단 양념! 김치찌개는 맛이특이한데 맛있다. 팁이 쎄서 조금 놀랐지만 여전히 강추!
Delicious Korean food! I really recommend this place. Spicy Yaki Udon was really good :))
Great KFC! Loved the whole chicken with half and half for two sauces. Very tasty and compares well to KFC from LA.
Tasty and huge portions!
This place is absolutely amazing!  This is a great spot for happy hour or post drink drunkies.   The kimchi dumplings are magical.
Delicious! Now I don't have to go to VA anymore.
Amazing, perfect spot for a casual dinner. The food is delicious. Also, the quantity is surprisingly good for the cost per item. 5/5⭐

It was just okay. The most glaring issue I had was with the very foul smell when we sat at our table. This should have been a sign. Food was okay. Good fries however, I don’t think I will be back. Mostly because of the smell, it made my imagination start to run wild. Eat here on 10/13/17
Good comfort Korean food, though there is no Jazz as their website shows. Liked their Watermelon Drink.
Pretty much the only game in town for Korean bar food, but they do a great job at it. Their soju mixes are really good.
Spiciest wings in the city!

🐃BUL: Balancing Atmosphere and Authenticity  Located on restaurant row in Adams Morgan, BUL is obviously hustling to live up to its locale.  With a bar and decorations to fill out a skinny space, BUL 's ambience make it a great place to bring a friend for a quick drink or sample of Korean wings before heading off for an entree somewhere else.  The tapas side of the menu seems a fun adventure, however my bibimbap was a disappointment, this from someone who loves Bulgogi. As so often happens with Korean fare, the red spicy sauce on the side usually dominated any finer flavors underneath.  @kwavooo
Great tasting Korean food. Some of it is straight forward and tastes amazing and familiar, and some of it requires you to be a bit adventurous, but it's never disappointing.
Good Korean food.
Good value for the area. Not many vegan options, but there is a tofu dolsot that is vegan without the raw egg. One or two vegan apps, but the veggie gyoza has an egg wash and is preprepared.
In town for tourism, my girlfriend was raised on Korean food, this placed did not disappoint, a nice Americanized blend and friendly staff. Short ribs and sake!
Amazing and authentic Korean food in a super trendy street
Nice food
The food and staff were amazing

Used to be as great spot.  May still be, but last I went this past weekend and nothing really tasted....good.  Server also insisted I was wrong when I told them that the extra rice we ordered was cold and hard.  Needless to say, it was.  Lol. Recent menu change may be the culprit, however I thought I'd share.
Great food and service! Love the Soju!
Awesome place to eat. The food is one off which makes it worth coming out to even if you eat a lot of Korean food.
Sundubu Jiggae and seafood pancakes are amazing!

People are right- it has great service and the food is pretty good (and this was yesterdat-Saturday). Im giving it a 3 because they served us food with peanuts and there was no warning of peanuts in anything we ordered (my husband is allergic -they did comp us our app) and while he is sick i also ended up getting sick from my food and i didnt touch the peanut riddled food. Not sure what batch we got, but it wasn't a great experience considering all I heard about the place. You have to have some kind of warnibg label about foods people could be allergic to. Not sure if everything is fried in peanut oil which is why I got sick too or if this was a bad batch. Either way, won't be making a return here.
Everything was awesome!
Delicious, delicious, delicious! Get the Korean Fried Chicken and you won't regret it!

Went there early on a Sunday night, and the place was quiet (just a handful of other patrons) and service was nice & unobtrusive. They didn't have any signage on the outside of the restaurant, which was confusing, but the inside is quite gorgeous.  Food was yummy, and definitely not Americanized...if you've never had Korean food, prepare for a unique new flavor experience.  Got the Dukbokki (not too spicy) and Seafood Pancake (really crispy delicious dough, but I wasn't a huge fan of the octopus tentacles...my friend loved it though!). Also, do yourself a favor and get the yuzu tea - slightly sweet and fruity/lemony. Delicious.
one of very few places in DC  where you can drink PyongYang SOJU from North Korea!!

One of my favorite places in DC. Bul has sparked an appreciation within me for Korean food. Set in the bustling strip of Adams Morgan, the service isn't always the most prompt. The food on the other hand is packed with flavor. I recommend the Jjampong if you enjoy seafood, one of my many favorite dishes here!
An excellent place for Korean food. Try the yuzu tea!
Food was good but not cheap
Every time I have been here the food has been delicious and service has been great. I definitely recommend the k-pork fried rice and the fried chicken.
Sub standard Korean fare. Pork belly was thin and fatty, not much else stood out.
Delicious and fun. Crowded. Service could improve.
Cool atmosphere and excellent food at good price for value. Look for the building's facade art and the sign printed on the glass of the door to the side. Otherwise, it's hard to find!
Cool looking place, but the flavors are a bit too Americanized

Bul is fantastic and a welcome addition to Adams Morgan. It took way too long for me to give this joint a shot. I had the fried chicken, which was truly incredible -- although it took a while to get it to the table, so make sure to order it before you place the rest of your order. Everything else at the table was good too. You can't really go wrong.
The best Korean restaurant in DC!
Food, drink, service; all fantastic.
Food was nice. Staff looks angry though
Went here with a large group. While their drinks menu is not extensive they do some interesting Korean food items like fried chicken, bibimbap.
Food was excellent, my family loved their food. I went outside of my comfort zone,and I thought it was good. Nice place in a good area of DC. I will go back when I return to the area.

They really have bad credit. They charged me $21 for tips but it's the total amount I signed on the receipt. I meal I ate it's only $17. How dare they!  Luckily I reviewed my card statements. I will never eat there!

My wife and I are suckers for good Korean food so when we found out there was a new Korean restaurant in the heart of Adams Morgan, we had to check it out. We tried to make a reservation, but it turns out we didn't need one on a Thursday night at 8PM.  After dining at Bul, we give it a 4-star rating. Here's why:  One star: For location. It's in the heart of Adams Morgan, making it convenient if you're already in the area.  One star:For atmosphere. The decor inside uses exposed brick and it has a fun lay out with a second floor that over looks the first floor.  One star: For their drinks. They make a killer seasonal drink. They take a small watermelon and gut it. They then use the juice to make a watermelon soju with soju and Sprite. It's $19 but can serve two people. It's so good!  One star: For their food. It's good. My wife loved her spicy seafood yaki udon noodles and my bulgogi rice had the perfect ratio or meat, rice, and veggies.  Here's what prevented us from giving it a fifth star:  The service was a little slow and it took awhile for us to get our meals. Also, the food is great, but as a former Mount Pleasant resident, I miss Adams Express, the best Korean food in DC until they closed.
A little pricy but ok Korean food. Not great for large groups.

I have only ever done take out, since I work in the area, so this review is not reflective of ambiance or service.  I usually get the 1/2 Korean Fried Chicken and the K-Pork Fried Rice. Both are outstanding. The chicken is some of the best fried chicken I have had, period. It is incredibly juicy and hot. The batter is lighter and crunchier than typical fried chicken. The fried rice has excellent flavor and a pretty decent kick of heat. My coworkers and I are always eager to order and share what we get. These two dishes alone (1/2 Fried Chicken and Fried Rice) are enough to feed 3 people with a bit of left over.
Nouveau Korean. Very tasty. Must try the fried chick
I had the spicy pork dolsot. Quite tasty. a bit pricey however.

Lived in Korea for a bit as an adult and was close with a Korean family growing up (I am not Korean)...so when I look for a Korean restaurant, I don't want the place that caters to Americans, I want authentic.  This place was trendy and a great atmosphere, but as soon as I told the waitress that we (my husband and I) knew and really loved Korean and asked what she recommended, she pointed us in the right direction and everything we were served was amazing.  The Kimchi dumplings (steamed, not fried) were out of this world.  She said the dumplings were handmade by the owners mom and told us we had to try them, and the pork bulgogi and kimchi (we got a few other small sides as well) were great.  Highly recommended!
Got foot poisoning from this place...Dined with 3 other people and we all got different dishes....and we all didn't enjoy our meals. Won't be going back.

Solid Korean fare. Veggie dumplings are superb. Bulgogi is average. Fried chicken is oddly chopped into small pieces (though still on the bone) and batter is very pepper heavy — even the naked or sweet soy varieties have a kick to them; spicy variety is tasty. Service is friendly though didn't know much about the menu. Space is deceptively large with plenty of seating.

Meh. The appetizers were a mixed bag: the seafood spring rolls are delicious; octopus was rubbery. My main course, a pricey plate of beef short ribs, was incredibly difficult to eat. The meat itself was OK, but overcooked. Recommend spending your money elsewhere, better places abound, even along the same block.

Stopped in here with a friend the other night to grab a quick beer and some appetizers before a show. Service was great and the food was okay. We ordered the chicken meatballs and the Dukbokki (spicy rice cake, and fish cake). My friend is from Korea and said the meatball was a little off but the Dukbokki was close to what they have from the vendors at home though lacking in its true spiciness.
This place was perfect for exactly what we were looking to do; have some food with great company. A+ on the crispiness of of the seafood pancake!
